description: From Latin expectorātus, past participle of expectorāre (“only fig. banish from the mind, but literally (as in modern use) expel from the breast”), from ex (“out of”) + pectus (“the breast”).

verbs.description: expectorate (third-person singular simple present expectorates, present participle expectorating, simple past and past participle expectorated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To cough up fluid from the lungs.
